intro: Mitracarpus parvulus, commonly known as the small-fruited mitracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Mitracarpus parvulus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
